page.title: 16Transport.
page.content:
Residents in the southern and upper end of Sleights village are served by {regular buses along the A169}to Whitby and also to Pickering, though these are less frequent.
The nearest railway station is at the northern end of Sleights by the River Esk about a mile from the "top" of the village.This is the{Esk Valley Line} between Whitby and Middlesborough.
{Private transport}is the norm for most residents, a great asset to visitors, and often essential for residents who work outside the area.Lack of such transport restricts shopping and entertainment choices and is sometimes a serious problem for the elderly.
